name: GITHUB__LIST_STARGAZERS
description: Lists the users who have starred a specified repository

path.description: Path parameters for the http request

owner.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

repo.description: The name of the repository without the .git extension. The name is not case sensitive.

query.description: Optional query parameters for the http request

per_page.description: The number of results per page (max 100). For more information, see https://docs.github.com/en/rest/using-the-rest-api/using-pagination-in-the-rest-api

page.description: The page number of the results to fetch

name: GITHUB__GET_USER
description: Provides publicly available information about someone with a GitHub account

path.description: Path parameters for the http request

username.description: The username of the user to fetch

name: GITHUB__GET_USER_SOCIAL_ACCOUNTS
description: Lists social media accounts for a user

path.description: Path parameters for the http request

username.description: The username of the user to fetch

query.description: Optional query parameters for the http request

per_page.description: The number of results per page (max 100). For more information, see https://docs.github.com/en/rest/using-the-rest-api/using-pagination-in-the-rest-api

page.description: The page number of the results to fetch

name: GITHUB__STAR_REPOSITORY
description: Stars a repository on behalf of the authenticated user

path.description: Path parameters for the http request

owner.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

repo.description: The name of the repository without the .git extension. The name is not case sensitive.

name: GITHUB__LIST_REPOSITORIES
description: Lists public repositories for the specified user

path.description: Path parameters for the http request

username.description: The username of the user whose repositories to list

query.description: Optional query parameters for the http request

type.description: Specifies the types of repositories to return. Can be one of: all, owner, member

sort.description: The property to sort the results by

direction.description: The order to sort by. Default: asc when using full_name, otherwise desc

per_page.description: The number of results per page (max 100)

page.description: The page number of the results to fetch

name: GITHUB__GET_REPOSITORY
description: Gets information about a repository

path.description: Path parameters for the http request

owner.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

repo.description: The name of the repository without the .git extension. The name is not case sensitive.

name: GITHUB__LIST_COMMITS
description: Lists commits for a repository

path.description: Path parameters for the http request

owner.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

repo.description: The name of the repository without the .git extension. The name is not case sensitive.

query.description: Optional query parameters for the http request

sha.description: SHA or branch to start listing commits from

path.description: Only commits containing this file path will be returned

author.description: GitHub login or email address by which to filter by commit author

since.description: Only show commits after this timestamp (ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ)

until.description: Only show commits before this timestamp (ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ)

per_page.description: The number of results per page (max 100)

page.description: The page number of the results to fetch

name: GITHUB__GET_COMMIT
description: Gets a specific commit from a repository

path.description: Path parameters for the http request

owner.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

repo.description: The name of the repository without the .git extension. The name is not case sensitive.

name: GITHUB__LIST_ISSUES
description: Lists issues in a repository

path.description: Path parameters for the http request

owner.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

repo.description: The name of the repository without the .git extension. The name is not case sensitive.

query.description: Optional query parameters for the http request

state.description: Indicates the state of the issues to return

direction.description: The direction to sort the results by

since.description: Only show issues updated after this timestamp (ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ)

per_page.description: The number of results per page (max 100)

page.description: The page number of the results to fetch

name: GITHUB__GET_ISSUE
description: Gets a specific issue from a repository

path.description: Path parameters for the http request

owner.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

repo.description: The name of the repository without the .git extension. The name is not case sensitive.

issue_number.description: The number that identifies the issue

name: GITHUB__CREATE_ISSUE
description: Creates a new issue in a repository

path.description: Path parameters for the http request

owner.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

repo.description: The name of the repository without the .git extension. The name is not case sensitive.

body.description: The JSON payload containing issue details

assignees.description: Logins for Users to assign to this issue

labels.description: Labels to associate with this issue

name: GITHUB__CREATE_PULL_REQUEST
description: Creates a new pull request in a GitHub repository

path.description: Path parameters for the http request

owner.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

repo.description: The name of the repository without the .git extension. The name is not case sensitive.

body.description: The JSON payload containing pull request details

title.description: The title of the pull request

body.description: The contents of the pull request

head.description: The name of the branch where your changes are implemented. For cross-repository pull requests in the same network, namespace head with a user like: 'username:branch'.

base.description: The name of the branch you want the changes pulled into. This should be an existing branch on the current repository.

draft.description: Indicates whether the pull request is a draft

name: GITHUB__FORK_REPOSITORY
description: Forks a repository to the authenticated user's account

path.description: Path parameters for the http request

owner.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

repo.description: The name of the repository without the .git extension. The name is not case sensitive.

body.description: The JSON payload containing fork details

organization.description: Optional organization name to fork the repository to

name.description: Optional name for the forked repository

default_branch_only.description: When forking from a private repository, fork only the default branch

name: GITHUB__CREATE_BRANCH
description: Creates a new branch in a GitHub repository

path.description: Path parameters for the http request

owner.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

repo.description: The name of the repository without the .git extension. The name is not case sensitive.

body.description: The JSON payload containing branch details

ref.description: The name of the fully qualified reference (refs/heads/...)

sha.description: The SHA1 value to set this reference to

name: GITHUB__LIST_PULL_REQUESTS
description: Lists pull requests in a repository

path.description: Path parameters for the http request

owner.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

repo.description: The name of the repository without the .git extension. The name is not case sensitive.

query.description: Optional query parameters for the http request

state.description: Either open, closed, or all to filter by state

head.description: Filter pulls by head user or head organization and branch name in the format of user:ref-name or organization:ref-name

base.description: Base branch name to filter the pulls by

per_page.description: The number of results per page (max 100)

page.description: The page number of the results to fetch

name: GITHUB__GET_PULL_REQUEST
description: Gets a specific pull request from a repository

path.description: Path parameters for the http request

owner.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

repo.description: The name of the repository without the .git extension. The name is not case sensitive.

pull_number.description: The number that identifies the pull request

name: GITHUB__MERGE_PULL_REQUEST
description: Merges a pull request

path.description: Path parameters for the http request

owner.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

repo.description: The name of the repository without the .git extension. The name is not case sensitive.

pull_number.description: The number that identifies the pull request

body.description: The JSON payload containing merge details

commit_title.description: Title for the automatic commit message

commit_message.description: Extra detail to append to automatic commit message

name: GITHUB__SEARCH_CODE
description: Searches for code in repositories on GitHub

query.description: Query parameters for the http request

q.description: The search query. For information about the syntax, see https://docs.github.com/search-github/searching-on-github/searching-code

per_page.description: The number of results per page (max 100)

page.description: The page number of the results to fetch

name: GITHUB__SEARCH_USERS
description: Searches for users on GitHub

query.description: Query parameters for the http request

q.description: The search query. For information about the syntax, see https://docs.github.com/search-github/searching-on-github/searching-users

per_page.description: The number of results per page (max 100)

page.description: The page number of the results to fetch

name: GITHUB__GET_FILE_CONTENT
description: Gets the content of a file from a repository

path.description: Path parameters for the http request

owner.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

repo.description: The name of the repository without the .git extension. The name is not case sensitive.

path.description: The path to the file

query.description: Optional query parameters for the http request

ref.description: The name of the commit/branch/tag. Default: the repository's default branch (usually master)

name: GITHUB__CREATE_OR_UPDATE_FILE
description: Creates a new file or updates an existing file in a repository

path.description: Path parameters for the http request

owner.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

repo.description: The name of the repository without the .git extension. The name is not case sensitive.

path.description: The path to the file

body.description: The JSON payload containing file details

content.description: The new file content, using Base64 encoding

sha.description: Required if you are updating a file. The blob SHA of the file being replaced

branch.description: The branch name. Default: the repository's default branch (usually master)

committer.description: The person that committed the file

name: GITHUB__LIST_BRANCHES
description: Lists branches for a repository

path.description: Path parameters for the http request

owner.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

repo.description: The name of the repository without the .git extension. The name is not case sensitive.

query.description: Optional query parameters for the http request

protected.description: Setting to true returns only protected branches

per_page.description: The number of results per page (max 100)

page.description: The page number of the results to fetch

name: GITHUB__GET_BRANCH
description: Gets a specific branch of a repository

path.description: Path parameters for the http request

owner.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

repo.description: The name of the repository without the .git extension. The name is not case sensitive.

name: GITHUB__GET_COMMIT_STATUS
description: Gets the combined status for a specific commit

path.description: Path parameters for the http request

owner.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

repo.description: The name of the repository without the .git extension. The name is not case sensitive.

ref.description: The commit reference (SHA, branch name, or tag name)

query.description: Optional query parameters for the http request

per_page.description: The number of results per page (max 100)

page.description: The page number of the results to fetch

name: GITHUB__CREATE_COMMIT_STATUS
description: Creates a status for a specific commit

path.description: Path parameters for the http request

owner.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

repo.description: The name of the repository without the .git extension. The name is not case sensitive.

body.description: The JSON payload containing status details

target_url.description: The target URL to associate with this status

description.description: A short description of the status

context.description: A string label to differentiate this status from others

name: GITHUB__SEARCH_REPOSITORIES
description: Searches for repositories on GitHub

query.description: Query parameters for the http request

q.description: The search query. For information about the syntax, see https://docs.github.com/search-github/searching-on-github/searching-for-repositories

per_page.description: The number of results per page (max 100)

page.description: The page number of the results to fetch

name: GITHUB__UPDATE_PULL_REQUEST

pull_number.description: The number that identifies the pull request

body.description: The JSON payload containing pull request update details

title.description: The title of the pull request

body.description: The contents of the pull request

base.description: The branch you want your changes pulled into

draft.description: Indicates whether the pull request is a draft

name: GITHUB__ADD_ISSUE_LABELS
description: Adds labels to an issue

path.description: Path parameters for the http request

owner.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

repo.description: The name of the repository without the .git extension. The name is not case sensitive.

issue_number.description: The number that identifies the issue

body.description: The labels to add to the issue

name: GITHUB__CREATE_REPOSITORY
description: Creates a new repository for the authenticated user

body.description: The JSON payload containing repository details

description.description: A short description of the repository

auto_init.description: Whether to create an initial commit with README
